items.sentence: How do you plan to stop Tom from doing that?
How do you plan to keep Tom from doing that?
I don't think you should ask Tom to do that.
I thought I would be able to do that better.
I don't have a logical explanation for this.
I suggested that Tom try different approach.
Why didn't you tell us we shouldn't do that?
Why didn't you tell us we needed to do that?
Why didn't you tell me that you were coming?
We'll run out of money if we're not careful.
There's no evidence that that ever happened.
It got dark, so Tom decided to go back home.
I have a sister who's pretty good at tennis.
If the rest of us can survive, you can, too.
Tom stayed home to care for his sick mother.
Tom was much better at doing that than Mary.
Tom was really surprised when that happened.
I have no desire to get my hair cut shorter.
Apparently, Tom managed to weasel out of it.
Don't you think that you'll be back by 2:30?
